description: crash every time i try to load the app some kind of crash then i am at the login screen
only few screen saver availalbe other are need to install

As finix mentioned, it doesn't have many installed by default but that's easy to remedy by installing the extra packages. This should have a note in the packages description on how to do this.

sudo apt install xscreensaver-data xscreensaver-*

This will install:
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-gl' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-data' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-screensaver-bsod' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-data-extra' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-screensaver-dizzy' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-screensaver-webcollage' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
Note, selecting 'xscreensaver-gl-extra' for glob 'xscreensaver-*'
summary: Solid screensaver app. Much better if you install extras

description: i love wallpapers
summary: one of my all time favorite and must install app for me

description:
It comes up correctly after my specified time, but I'd like for it to lock my screen immediately. I have it set to lock after 0 minutes, and the checkbox ticked. But it just does the screensaver.

But, from what I've used, the screensavers are awesome. Keep up the good work! I REALLY like the flying toasters one by the way.
summary: It doesn't lock my screen - Ubuntu 18.04.2

description:
Any Distro any time - this has been my all time favorite screensaver - it has some starting troubles but I will choose to ignore them

Easy to set up and fun to tweak 

Go for it hands down
just installed, works fine
Lots of beautiful animations. Will be setting my screensaver to start at 5 minutes just to see them.

Works fine but recently my system has started hanging while the screensaver is running. I'm not absolutely sure this is the cause but it started happening the day after installing this. I'll delete this review if my system keeps hanging after i have uninstalled.
summary: Great screensavers but system started crashing

description:
followed instructions by "paradox"
xscreensaver works fine, including lock
flying toasters reminiscent of "After Dark"
Nice collection of screensavers, find Bouncing Cow

Works under Ubuntu 19.10 with the extra packages installed as suggested below (thank you to poster).

The default lock screen and other screen savers I tried blanked out the screen which shut off the Samsung monitor. Which meant I have to keep pressing the ON (joystick) button in the back on an older monitor, the button is probably not going to survive a year doing that.

I tested it, it correctly locked the screen after removing the default screen savers and others I had tried.

Thank you again.
summary: works under Ubuntu 19.10 with extra package

description: This is a great app when it works with Ubuntu, even if the Software Center is behind on releases (installs 5.40 but jwz.org lists 5.43). Installed and ran on Admin just fine but, refuses to run on limited user account: "Error could not write to "/home/ubuntu/.xscreensaver". The directory exists at that location but, after multiple install, purge, and re-install, it still refuses to write to the directory. Am going to install from source code but, that has always been a hassle.Have not seen a permissions button.
summary: Will not install on standard user account on U-18

description: Really like the "xmatrix" and "glmatrix" ones. I suggest for you to install all packages related to "xscreensaver" in Synaptic Package Manager. Great application!
even better if you install the extras
I'm unsure if there's just some drivers of sorts that I'm missing, but when I installed it all of the screensavers available were extremely broken and buggy looking, some not even displaying at all.

In Windows i used a screensaver that that ran a slideshow of my i8mages; I couldn't seem to do this in Ubuntu until I found this one, it is far superior to the Windows offering and has some brilliant savers to choose from.
It also allows the user to set up the times and delays to suit one's taste

My favourite screen svaer, just make sure you install the extra's to get the full use of this module
xscreensaver-gl
xscreensaver-gl-extra
xscreensaver-data-extra
Install ether by synaptic or apt.

better than all the rest.

curiously though, despite having a GUI I have to launch via CLI. I know I could fix that because once xscreensaver-demo is issued, everything's gravy. I just haven't dug done into it yet. regardless, I had to show some love for an old favorite.

Works well on Ubuntu 20. 
Be sure to install the extras with:

sudo apt install xscreensaver-data xscreensaver- data-extra xscreensaver-gl xscreensaver-gl-extra

Start the daemon and run the demo with:
xscreensaver & xscreensaver-demo

The demo allows you to configure lots of options. Definitely run the demo and read the manual or FAQ at the website.
Love all of the screensavers!

I was mainly after the Matrix screensaver I had on a Linux Mint laptop about 20 years ago. I think it was in the 
sudo apt install xscreensaver-gl
or 
sudo apt install xscreensaver-gl-extra
group of uninstalled options.
summary: Thanks "paradox" for making me understand it

description: I don't have a use for this app anymore, but I can't remove it. It's super frustrating.

just make sure you install the extras using:

sudo apt install xscreensaver-data xscreensaver-*

My favorite Linux screensaver by far.

Dont forget:

sudo apt install xscreensaver-data xscreensaver-*

to install the extra screensavers

I love the sreensaver selsction and customizability. however there were 2 big issues that I personally had for some reason. One issue was that even using the right settings, the secreensavers never actually worked. The other issue that I had was that when I previewed the screensavers, they would run super sluggushly, usually from 10fps to 40fps. This was odd to me as my computer is fairly powerful, and I'm running vanilla Ubuntu on the latest update.
wow i found here the C64 screensaver

I've been a Linux user for nearly ten years now. Screensavers have been one of the more lackluster aspects of every distro in my experience. Its best to take into account your particular system and explore what the community is doing in similar circumstances before choosing. And sometimes it's better to follow community advice on how to install Xscreensaver from the terminal, but generally this has everything you need. With some familiarity and after installing the extras you'll find with some tweaking you can put together an elegant screensaver for your setup.
Installed the program and the additional screensavers with no problem. They all worked great. Would definitely recommend  this....
Yes in this day and age we don't really use them but nice to look at when you want to relax not bad at all.
these are simply the best screensavers, they trigger nostalgia and are super light on the processor would give 100/5 stars if possible.
This is one of the best XScreenSaver for linux distros. To get the other xscreensaver-data, best to use synaptic package manager to download all the screensaver data + gl version.
the android ver is better.

The version that is currently shipped by Ubuntu & Debian is out of date and needs to be updated.
Unfortunately, the developer does not offer a Flatpak or Snap version of xScreenSaver so you must build the latest version from source on Debian-based systems if you want to use the most up to date version of xScreenSaver.

description:
To install the remaining screensavers, type the following in Console:


sudo apt install xscreensaver-data xscreensaver-*

Encontré un bug importante, al ir explorando y revisando la lista, llegué al protector de pantalla llamado "Unicrud", y justo al hacerle click, la sesión se cerró. Tuve que volver a iniciar sesión con mi contraseña, y todos los programas se cerraron. Volví a entrar a esta aplicación y desafortunadamente la selección quedó fija en "Unicrud", de modo que siempre que la abro, se me cierra forzadamente la sesión.

Voy a desinstalar y reinstalar.

[Lubuntu 22.04, Dell Inspiron 1110]
не устанавливал, но посмотрел сайт программы с примерами, ничего не скажешь, одни эмоции. молодцы ребята.
